qas.question: What is the best known Korean dish made with dog meat?
Why do people eat Gaejang-guk in the summer months?
What is dog meat boiled with to create Gaejang-guk?
When is the Korean dog recipe usually eaten?
What are two other ingredients in the dog meat recipe in Korea?

context: The most popular Korean dog dish is <a0_0>gaejang-guk<a0_0/> (also called bosintang), <a1_0>a spicy stew<a1_0/> meant <a2_0>to balance the body's heat<a2_0/> during <a4_0>the summer months<a4_0/>; followers of the custom claim this is done to ensure good health by balancing one's gi, or vital energy of the body. A 19th century version of gaejang-guk explains that the dish is prepared by boiling dog meat with <a3_0><a5_0>scallions and chili powder.<a5_0/><a3_0/> Variations of the dish contain chicken and bamboo shoots. While the dishes are still popular in Korea with a segment of the population, dog is not as widely consumed as beef, chicken, and pork.
